what does chronic kidney disease mean?
responses: Chronic kidney disease (CKD): This damage causes waste to build up in your body, which can lead to other health problems. Symptoms include weight loss and poor appetite, itchy skin, blood in your pee (urine), shortness of breath. Swollen ankles, feet, or hands. Its treatment is angiotensin-converting enzyme. Is there anything else I can help you with?

Chronic kidney disease (CKD): When your kidneys are damaged, waste builds up in your body, causing other health issues. Weight loss and a lack of appetite are common symptoms, as are itchy skin, blood in the urine, and shortness of breath. ankles, feet, or hands that are swollen. It can be treated by: Statins. Is there anything else I can help you with?
